review: First off, I will say that I am not a fan of Apple Products. I don't have an IPad or IPhone, although my wife and kids do. The products we do have at home are all jailbroken so that I can get XBMC on them. I have a Samsung Galaxy tablet because I could easily install XBMC. Now to the point. I just got a new TV in a recreational room and wanted a way to watch XBMC on it. We don't have cable because we stream XBMC and Netflix all throughout the house. I looked at alot of different products and settled between The Apple TV and the Matricom MX2. I did not like the Matricom box because of the negative reviews. It took alot for to get the Apple TV because like I said I am not a fan of Apple products. I got it anyway and figured that i could jailbreak it and put a sticker over the Apple logo. However, I found I could not jailbreak the Apple TV and almost considered returning it. I did some research using Bing, and found an app called AirParrot. It was a $10 product and it allows me to mirror my Windows laptop to the Apple TV for XBMC. My kids can also mirror their IPhones to it as well. It works like a charm. I am really impressed on how well it works on wifi and how clear the picture is. The other morning I was having a bowl of cereal and watching the Smithsonian channel before I went to work. I wont go as far to say that I am an Apple fan but this really is an excellent product. If a jailbreak ever comes out for mine, I don't even think I will jailbreak because its mounted to the TV and Airplay mirroring works great. In my opinion, if you are looking for a powerful little device to satisfy your streaming needs, this is the product for you. The capability is there, you just have to fins what works best for you.
